letters:
I hope this message finds you well. I've been reflecting on our recent conversations, and I want to take a moment to apologize sincerely for my lack of support during your time of need. 

I realize that I wasn’t there for you when you really needed a friend, and I deeply regret that my actions—or lack thereof—didn’t convey how much I care about you. You deserved someone to lean on, and I failed to be that person. 

I want you to know that I am truly sorry for not being more attentive and present. Your feelings and experiences matter to me, and it pains me to think that I may have added to your burden instead of helping to lighten it. 

Please know that I am here for you now. I value our friendship deeply, and I hope to earn back your trust. I am committed to being a better friend moving forward, and I am ready to listen and support you in any way you need.

Thank you for your understanding, and I hope we can talk soon. 

With all my heartfelt apologies,  
[Your Name]

Dear [Friend's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my sincerest apologies for my lack of support during a time when you needed it most. I recognize that I failed to be there for you in a meaningful way, and for that, I am truly sorry.

Reflecting on our recent interactions, I realize how important it is for friends to stand by one another, especially during challenging times. You were facing difficult circumstances, and my inability to provide the support you deserved was deeply disappointing. I regret not being more attentive and present, and I understand how my actions, or lack thereof, may have affected you.

Please know that it was never my intention to undermine your feelings or experience. I value our friendship immensely and am committed to doing better in the future. Your feelings matter to me, and I want to ensure that you always feel supported and understood.

I hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me, and I welcome the opportunity to make amends and be a better friend moving forward. If you are open to it, I would love to discuss how I can support you in the future.

Thank you for considering my apology. I look forward to rebuilding your trust in me.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]

I’ve been doing a lot of thinking lately, and I need to reach out to you about something that’s been weighing heavily on my heart. I realize that during your time of need, I was not the friend you deserved. I didn't offer the support you needed, and I’m truly sorry for that.

It hurts me to know that I let you down when you needed someone to lean on. I can only imagine how difficult that time was for you, and I regret not being there to help you through it. I want you to know that I deeply value our friendship, and it pains me to think that my actions may have caused you more hurt.

I am committed to being a better friend for you moving forward. If you’re willing, I would love the opportunity to talk about it and understand how I can support you better. Your feelings matter to me, and I want to rebuild the trust that I’ve broken.

Thank you for your understanding, and I hope we can move forward together. Please know that I’m really sorry for not being there when you needed me most. You mean a lot to me, and I hope to prove that in the future. 

Take care, and I hope to hear from you soon.
